message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.LG, cs.SD 

This paper is about automatic summarization techniques on meeting conversations, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper proposes an approach to generate abstractive summaries by fusing important content from several utterances using an integer linear programming-based sentence fusion approach. This involves techniques such as dependency graph fusion, which are commonly used in NLP and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.CL (Computation and Language) and cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). Other possible sub-categories include cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.LG (Machine Learning), and cs.SD (Sound).
